answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found a number of places that have also decided to privatize their local animal shelters. You may want to contact them directly for more information about the programs. 
Canyon County, Idaho decided this summer to privatize their shelter.
http://www.ktvb.com/news/local/Canyon-County-Animal-Shelter-to-be-privatized-127559758.html
A couple of years ago Kansas City, Missouri privatized its shelter and has found the move to be very successful.
http://reason.org/blog/show/animal-shelter-privatization-s
Los Angeles also recently voted to transfer control of their shelter to a non-profit group.
http://articles.latimes.com/2011/aug/17/local/la-me-0817-animal-shelter-20110817
The town of Riverhead, New York has considered privatizing its local shelter.
http://riverheadnewsreview.timesreview.com/2011/09/24191/town-in-talks-to-privatize-animal-shelter/
Memphis is currently discussing the possibility of a bringing in a private contractor to run the local shelter.
http://www.wmctv.com/story/16395967/memphis-seeks-private-owner-for-animal-shelter
This is a copy of the contract between the City of Sedona, AZ and the Humane Society.
http://icma.org/en/icma/knowledge_network/documents/kn/Document/14039/Humane_Society_Contract
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern 
aiannolo@ICMA.org
